item.title: Best Weapons In Stardew Valley, Ranked
item.description:
A large aspect of Stardew Valley is collecting ores and minerals for crafting and upgrading. But the mines are littered with deadly slimes, crabs, mummies, serpents, etc., so it’s important to have a strong weapon. Clearing the mines and dungeons will also allow players to complete quests, get shiny gifts for villagers they want to romance, and explore new and exciting areas within the game.

There are four different types of weapons within Stardew Valley ; Swords, Daggers, Clubs, and Slingshots. These weapons all come with different stats to help players move faster, build their defense, increase the chance for a critical attack, and much more. These are the best weapons in Stardew Valley .

Updated on September 7, 2024, by Usama Ali: One of the main skills the farmer needs to learn in Stardew Valley is Combat. Some weapons in Stardew Valley can provide various Stat boosts, such as increased damage, critical hit chance, or attack speed, which can impact the farmer’s combat ability. This guide has now been updated with some of the best weapons to equip in Stardew Valley’s 1.6 update.

19 Wicked Kris

24-30 Damage, +4 Crit Chance

  • How to get it : Dropped by Haunted Skulls (Quarry and Mines) and in Boxes and Barrels

As a rule, daggers are faster than any other melee weapon in Stardew Valley . Although the damage might be lower, the ability to land more strikes makes daggers an excellent choice for combat. The Wicked Kris is one of the stronger daggers, dealing between 24-30 damage with each strike - earning this vicious little weapon its name.

Finding a Wicked Kris is easier than a lot of other weapons, although it cannot be purchased from the Adventurer's Guild. There's a chance it'll be dropped by a Haunted Skull, which inhabits both The Quarry and the Mines. It can also be found by breaking boxes and barrels in the mines, which means players better start smashing.

18 Master Slingshot

Damage Dependent on Ammo (Est. 50-202)

  • How to get it : Floor 70 of The Mines

The Master Slingshot is the best slingshot in Stardew Valley . It can be found on floor 70 in The Mines as a reward for descending. This weapon can be challenging to use, but as the only projectile weapon in the game, it can be useful for taking out monsters at a distance.

The damage a slingshot can deal is completely dependent on the type of ammunition equipped. To do the most damage, players should use Iridium ore which causes 50-202 damage, or Gold which does 30-122.

17 Dwarf Dagger

32-38 Damage, +1 Speed

  • How to get it : 1/21 Chance of spawning in a common chest

If fans are looking for a strong defensive weapon, the Dwarf Dagger is a fantastic way to keep those monsters at bay. To obtain this weapon, players must explore the Volcano Dungeon on Ginger Island. The dagger has a 1/21* chance of being found in a common chest.

With a defense statistic of +6, this dagger has the highest defense level in Stardew Valley . Additionally, the Dwarf Dagger gives players +1 Speed, +2 Crit Chance, and +5 Weight. In total, it can deal 32- 38 damage to monsters.

16 Yeti Tooth

26-42 Damage, +4 Defense, +10 Crit. Power

  • How To Get It : Inside boxes and barrels on Floors 80-90 of the Mines.

The Yeti Tooth 's combination of high damage, critical power, and defense makes it an amazing weapon for early-game Stardew Valley players. This sword has a unique icy blue appearance, reflecting its Yeti origins. Even though the Yeti Tooth gives the impression that it has some chilling effects, it unfortunately does not.

The Yeti Tooth boasts a base damage of 26-42 and a +10 Critical Power, which deals additional damage on critical strikes. Additionally, the sword provides +4 Defense, offering decent protection against enemy attacks. It can be found by breaking boxes and barrels on Floors 80-90 of the Mines.

15 Tempered Broadsword

29-44 Damage, +3 Defense, +3 Weight

  • How To Get It : Inside boxes and barrels on Floors 40+ of the Skull Cavern.

While its attack speed is slower than some other swords, the Tempered Broadsword is definitely a reliable and sturdy weapon. It has a high base Damage of 29-44 and comes with a +3 Defense bonus, making it excellent for protecting against enemy attacks. Besides this, the Tempered Broadsword gives a +3 Weight bonus, which means it can knock enemies back even further when they get hit.

The Tempered Broadsword can be found inside boxes and barrels on Floors 40+ of the Skull Cavern. However, if players have enabled remixed rewards when starting a new save file, they may be able to get the Tempered Broadsword as a chest reward on Floor 90 of the Mines.

14 Steel Falchion

28-46 Damage, +4 Speed, +20 Crit. Power

  • How To Get It : After reaching Floor 90 of the Mines, purchase it from the Adventurer’s Guild for 9,000 gold.

While it may not be the most powerful weapon in the long run, The Steel Falchion is a decent sword for early-game players. Its combination of high critical power and fast attack speed makes it an impressive choice for a sword. With a +20 Critical Power stat, the Steel Falchion has a significantly higher chance of dealing additional damage on critical hits.

The Steel Falchion has a base Damage of 28-46 which is pretty decent for early and mid-game monsters. Players can purchase it from the Adventurer’s Guild for 9,000 gold, or find it inside boxes and barrels on floors 40+ of the Skull Cavern.

13 Obsidian Edge

30-45 Damage, -1 Speed, +10 Crit Power

  • How to get it : Floor 90 of The Mines

Obsidian Edge is cool in both appearance and name. This wicked black blade does between 30-45 damage, giving it one of the broader damage ranges out of Stardew's weapons. Unfortunately, this heavy sword does come with a -1 speed nerf, which balances out with a +10 crit power. While this seems like a rough deal, most big weapons come with a speed penalty to stop players from becoming invincible.

To obtain this sick sword, players will have to prove themselves in some serious combat. This weapon is located on floor 90 of The Mines, meaning it's not something all players will be able to get their hands on. To make it even more exclusive, Obsidian Edge isn't sold in the Adventurer's Guild - so only the bravest will wield it.

12 Dark Sword

30-45 Damage, 9% Vampiric

  • How to get it : Dropped by Haunted Skulls

The Dark Sword is a fan favorite. This weapon has some amazing stats, but to find it, players will require a little luck. In the Quarry, players will discover Skull Cavern. This area is populated with Haunted Skulls. When killing these mobs, there is a 1.3% chance that the Dark Sword will be dropped.

The best thing about the Dark Sword is its Vampiric stat. With this stat, players will have a 9% chance of gaining between 9-10.67% of a monster’s health after killing it. Additionally, this sword can deal 30-45 damage and has +2 crit chance, although it is slower than many other weapons with -5 speed and +5 weight.

11 Dragontooth Shiv

40-50 Damage, +100 Crit Power

  • How to get it : Open chests in the Volcano Dungeon

The Dragontooth Shiv is a level 12 weapon that's great for players who want decent damage with great crit power. If players aren't concerned about having a weapon with defense, then the Dragontooth Shiv is a good, quick weapon that will deal around 40-50 damage.

To obtain the Dragontooth Shiv, players will have to venture inside the Volcano on Ginger Island. It can be found in a dungeon chest within the Volcano Dungeon and has a whopping +100 Crit Power. This can easily quadruple the damage dealt if players land a critical hit.

10 Alex's Bat

40-55 Damage, -2 Speed

  • How to get it : Purchase it from Alex's stall at the Desert Festival

One of the biggest additions from Stardew Valley's 1.6 update is the introduction of new festivals. One of these new festivals takes place in the Calico Desert, and this time the various denizens of Pelican Town can be found pedaling their wares. While this is a great chance to gain some insight into the locals, it's also a great place to pick up some unique items.

Those who venture over to local sports star Alex's stall will come across his trusty bat, which deals 40-55 damage - not too shabby for some old equipment. Like all high-damage, heavy weapons, there's a speed penalty of -2. For players who like to hit hard and aren't too concerned about speed, Alex's Bat is a brilliant choice.

9 Infinity Dagger

50-70 Damage, +3 Defense, +4 Crit Chance

  • How to get it : Crafted in The Forge (Ginger Island) by combing the Galaxt Dagger, 3 Galaxy Souls, and 60 Cinder Shards

As one of the best daggers in Stardew Valley , the Infinity Dagger can cause 50-70 damage. Considered the true form of the Galaxy dagger, this weapon must be crafted in the forge on Ginger Island. This is done by combining the Galaxy dagger, three Galaxy Souls, and sixty Cinder Shards in the Forge.

When using the Infinity Dagger, players will benefit from weapon stats including, +1 speed, +3 defense, +4 crit chance, and +5 weight, making this a very handy weapon for exploring. If sold, this weapon would be worth 800g.

8 Lava Katana

55-64 Damage, +25 Crit Power

  • How to get it : Purchase it from the Adventurer's Guild for 25,000 gold (only after reaching the bottom of the mines)

The Lava Katana is a brilliant weapon choice because it's relatively easy to obtain for any seasoned explorer. Instead of mindlessly opening dungeon chests and hoping for it to appear, the Lava Katana can simply be bought from the Adventurer's Guild. The only caveat is that players must have reached the bottom of the mines first, otherwise it won't be available - and it does cost 25,000 Gold.

The upside is that the Lava Katana does brilliant damage, and has a +25 crit power which will deal a fantastic amount of damage if players manage to land a critical hit. The Lava Katana also offers a +3 to defense and a +3 to weight, which adds extra protection and increases knockback against enemies - which can be huge if players are low on health.

7 Dwarf Sword

65-75 Damage, +4 Defense, +2 Speed

  • How to get it : 1/21 Chance of spawning in a Volcano Dungeon chest

Like the Dwarf Dagger, the Dwarf Sword has a 1/21* chance of being found within common chests in the Volcano Dungeon on Ginger Island. But this weapon is much more powerful than its shorter counterpart, with damage ranging from 65-75.

The Dwarf Sword can be sold for 650g and has several qualities that make it stand out from other weapons. For instance, its high +4 defense and +2 speed stat allow players to take down multiple monsters quickly and efficiently.

6 Galaxy Sword

60-80 Damage, +4 Speed

  • How to get it : Take a Prismatic Shard to the 3 pillars in the Desert

The Galaxy Sword is often considered a favorite among Stardew Valley players thanks to the easter egg style way in which players can obtain it. It can inflict 60-80 damage and is aided by a massive +4 speed stat that makes it incredibly useful, especially earlier in the game.

To obtain this weapon, players must find a rare Prismatic Shard and take it to the center of the three pillars in the Desert. Once the Galaxy Sword is acquired, the Galaxy Hammer and Galaxy Dagger can be purchased at the Adventurer’s Guild. Be careful not to lose or sell this sword as it can only be sold for 650g, but to purchase a replacement will cost players a massive 50,000g.

5 Galaxy Hammer

70-90 Damage, +5 Weight

  • How to get it : Purchase it from the Adventurer's Guild for 70,000 gold (after unlocking the Galaxy Sword)

The Galaxy Hammer is a great heavy weapon choice for players who like weapons with good knockback. Most players don't hold onto it for too long as it's a key component in the creation of the Infinity Gavel - which deals the most damage in the game.

However, the Galaxy Hammer is powerful in its own right and can deal up to 90 damage with a normal hit. It also has a +5 weight which means it will knock enemies back further upon impact. It also gives a +2 speed, which means it's one of the few "heavy" weapons that won't slow players down when striking.

4 Dragontooth Cutlass

75-90 Damage, +50 Crit Power

  • How to get it : 1/27 chance of spawning in a Volcano Dungeon chest

If players can manage to get their hands on a Dragontooth Cutlass , they'll find themselves to be a formidable foe to any monster in the game. Not only does this weapon have fantastic base damage, dealing between 75 and 90, but it also has a +50 crit power - which means a critical hit can deal upwards of 300 damage.

This level 13 cutlass doesn't have any other extra perks, but a critical hit could easily one-shot most of the enemies in the game. The biggest drawback is that the Dragontooth Cutlass can only be found in chests inside the Volcano Dungeon on Ginger Island - and there's a 1 in 27 chance it will drop from a rare chest.

3 Dragontooth Club

80-100 Damage, +50 Crit Power

  • How to get it : 1/27 chance of spawning in a Volcano Dungeon chest

Clubs are some of the most powerful weapons in Stardew Valley , although their heavy weight and low speed can sometimes deter players. The Dragontooth Club , for example, can cause a whopping 80-100 damage to nearby monsters, making it a great weapon choice for exploring the Volcano Dungeon.

This club has +3 weight, which, combined with its enormous +50 crit power makes it lethal. However, due to its strength, the Dragon Tooth Club can be hard to find. Within the Volcano Dungeon, players must find a rare chest. They will then have a 1/27* chance of finding this club inside.

2 Infinity Blade

80-100 Damage, +4 Speed, +2 Defense

  • How to get it : Craftable in The Forge (Ginger Island) by combining the Galaxy Sword, 3 Galaxy Souls, and 60 Cinder Shards

The Infinity Blade is the next step up from the Galaxy Sword. It must be crafted in the Volcano Dungeon Forge using the Galaxy Sword, which can be obtained in the Calico Desert using a prismatic shard. Additionally, players will need three Galaxy Souls, and sixty Cinder Shards, both of which can be found on Ginger Island.

This sword can deal 80-100 damage with the addition of +4 speed and +2 defense. Because of these high stats, the Infinity Blade is often considered the most powerful sword one can own in Stardew Valley .

1 Infinity Gavel

100-120 Damage, +2 Speed

  • How to get it : Craftable in The Forge (Ginger Island) by combining the Galaxy Hammer, 3 Galaxy Souls, and 60 Cinder Shards

Like the other infinity weapons, the Infinity Gavel must be forged using the Galaxy Hammer, Galaxy Souls, and Cinder Shards. As such, it is a very powerful weapon to obtain, with the highest base damage in the game at 100-120.

On top of its damage, Infinity Gavel users benefit from +2 speed, +1 defense, and +5 weight. It’s also one of the most valuable weapons in the game with a sale price of 850g. However, players should think carefully before they sell this weapon at the Adventurers Guild as players cannot buy it back.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: 8 New Things Added In Patch 7
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Patch 7 offers new evil endings with cinematics, enhancing the dark side of Baldur's Gate 3.
  • Official mod support simplifies installing and managing mods directly in the game.
  • Honour Mode in Patch 7 introduces customizable rules and more challenging enemies for a hardcore experience.

More than a year after its initial release, Baldur’s Gate 3 continues to captivate players with its extensive, easily missed details and ongoing support from developers at Larian Studios. Recently, the highly anticipated Patch 7 for Baldur’s Gate 3 was rolled out, adding more content and improvements to enhance the game’s experience.

Now, players who opt for an evil path in their playthrough have even more reasons to stick to this route, thanks to new additions in Patch 7. Alongside this, numerous other changes have been introduced to refine the player experience further and improve the game’s already impressive quality.

8 Cinematics For Evil Endings

Patch 7 Brings Even More Terror To Baldur’s Gate 3

One of the most awaited features of Patch 7 for Baldur’s Gate 3 is the addition of new evil endings, with fully developed cinematics, now available for players. Previously, some felt that following an evil path in the game was not as rewarding, but this update changes that perception.

Players who pursue this dark route in the game can now experience a fitting conclusion to their characters' journeys. These new cinematics don’t require starting a new playthrough; simply load a save before the final battle against the Netherbrain, and the updated endings can be accessed based on previous choices.

7 Official Mod Support For Baldur’s Gate 3

Installing Mods Has Never Been Easier With Patch 7

Despite Baldur’s Gate 3 not having official mod support at launch, the community was quick to develop mods that enriched the game’s content. With Patch 7, official mod support is now available, making it easier than ever for players to install and manage mods within the game.

No longer needing third-party installers or external websites, players can now directly access community-made content from within the game itself. Several mods are already compatible with Patch 7, providing an even more customizable experience for those eager to enhance their adventure.

6 Baldur’s Gate 3 Toolkit Data

Creating Mods Is Now Simpler With Patch 7

In addition to official mod support, Patch 7 introduces the Baldur’s Gate 3 Toolkit Data, a powerful tool that simplifies the mod creation process. While this tool does not yet allow the creation of new campaigns or quests, it grants greater freedom to modders by making it easier to add new content like classes, spells, and gear.

This update provides an enhanced experience for mod creators, allowing them to expand on the existing game world of Faerûn, enriching the experience for everyone who enjoys mods.

5 Enhanced Local Multiplayer Experience

Local Co-Op In Baldur’s Gate 3 Just Got Better With Patch 7

Though local co-op has been available since the game's 2023 release, the mode has undergone several key improvements to make gameplay smoother and more immersive. Patch 7 brings significant enhancements, including dynamic screen merging when characters are close together and automatic screen separation when they move apart, which greatly improves the local co-op experience.

These changes, previously seen in Divinity: Original Sin 2 , make exploring the world together feel seamless, reducing visual fragmentation. Additional tweaks to overall performance further refine the co-op experience, making it more intuitive and enjoyable when playing with friends on a shared screen.

4 New Character Interactions

Larian Adds Both Major And Minor Details To Baldur’s Gate 3

A key element that makes Baldur’s Gate 3 stand out is the depth of its character interactions, something that has been further polished with Patch 7. Several characters now feature new animations and small interactions, such as Shadowheart petting Scratch, which adds extra layers to their personalities.

Astarion, in particular, has received unique new content, including a fresh dialogue that appears later in the game if the protagonist is in a relationship with him and decides to betray him with Mizora. These interactions deepen the narrative and character development, further enhancing the immersive quality of Baldur’s Gate 3 .

3 New Difficulty Options

Customizable Honour Mode Rules In Baldur’s Gate 3

Honour Mode introduced an intense level of difficulty to Baldur’s Gate 3 , where the entire save file could be permanently erased if the player’s party was wiped out, adding an element of high-stakes tension to every battle. This mode quickly became a favorite among players seeking a hardcore experience.

With Patch 7, some Honour Mode rules are now available for custom playthroughs. This allows players to tailor certain challenging aspects of the mode while adjusting the overall difficulty to their personal preference, making it possible to enjoy Baldur’s Gate 3 in a way that suits their own pace and playstyle.

2 More Powerful Enemies In Honour Mode

Patch 7 Brings Even More Challenge To Key Battles

Patch 7 has made Honour Mode even more demanding by introducing additional combat difficulties. Legendary foes, like Malus Thorm, now have new abilities such as Grasping Appendage , which add layers of complexity to encounters, requiring players to strategize even further.

Additionally, the Bulette has gained the ability Shredding Scales , and new githyanki leaders, such as Ch’r’ai Tska’an, can now use Soul Sacrifice , which intensifies combat encounters. These adjustments make battles more unpredictable, offering fresh challenges even to players familiar with the original difficulty.

1 Alfira Joins The Baldur’s Gate 3 Party Temporarily

Larian Has Fun With Fans In Patch 7

Alfira, the tiefling bard, is one of the most beloved secondary characters in Baldur’s Gate 3 . Many players have long requested that she be recruitable as a permanent party member. However, despite player requests, she is not officially recruitable. In fact, during a Dark Urge playthrough, players can deliver a grim fate to her character.

That said, Larian Studios teased the possibility of Alfira joining the party in Patch 7. For a brief moment, players can have her in their group, giving them a taste of what it might be like to have her as a party member. However, this is short-lived, and the story soon returns to its usual course, with Alfira remaining a non-recruitable NPC.

item.title: Stardew Valley: Most Difficult Bachelorettes to Date, Ranked
item.description:
Over the years, numerous tier lists have ranked the datable women in Stardew Valley from various angles, including their favorite gifts, styles, and heart events. However, because each marriage candidate has a unique personality and character development arc, players need to consider much more than just basic traits and appearance.

While there seems to be a consensus on the best bachelorette in Stardew Valley —supported by fan-provided stats and polls—one topic remains controversial: which bachelorettes are the most challenging to date? This question goes beyond just gifts or events and delves into their overall story arcs.

The following table summarizes the best and worst traits of all the romanceable women in Stardew Valley .

Bachelorette

Best Trait

Worst Trait

Abigail

Is cool and relatable

Can be immature and blunt

Maru

Is brilliant and independent

Can be cold and distant

Penny

Is levelheaded and loyal

Can be boring and detached

Leah

Is giving and passionate

Can be insecure and depressed

Haley

Is charming and confident

Can be childish and spoiled

Emily

Is honest and friendly

Can be a people-pleaser

6 Abigail

The Challenge: Not Falling for Her

  • Loved Items : Amethyst, Banana Pudding, Bakery Cobbler, Chocolate Cake, Pufferfish, Pumpkin, Spicey Eel, and Monster Compendium.

The fact that Abigail is the most commonly married NPC in Stardew Valley highlights how easily players are drawn to her. She’s kind and charming, and her intriguing backstory adds to her appeal, making her somewhat like the Sebastian of the bachelorettes.

However, despite being a favorite among many players, Abigail does have her flaws. She can be immature and blunt at times, and her quirky habits — such as eating rocks — might be off-putting to some.

5 Leah

The Challenge: Ignoring Her Green Flags

  • Loved Items : Goat Cheese, Poppyseed Muffin, Salad, Stir Fry, Truffle, Vegetable Medley, Wine.

Leah is the safest bet for marriage in Stardew Valley . Compassionate, kindhearted, and hardworking, she stands out as the ideal wife. Additionally, her strong connection to nature gives her a clear advantage in adjusting to the farmer’s lifestyle after marriage. For these reasons, Leah isn’t difficult to date at all.

She begins giving gifts to the player after the sixth Heart Event and maintains her enthusiasm even after marriage, unlike many other bachelorettes who may become lackluster spouses. The only drawback might be that her heart events are relatively underwhelming. Otherwise, there’s little reason not to consider her as a partner.

Leah gifts the player with an exotic sculpture during their sixth heart event.

4 Haley

The Challenge: Seeing Through Her Childish Personality

  • Loved Items : Coconut, Fruit Salad, Pink Cake, Sunflower.

Haley is the equivalent of Sam among the bachelorettes; she initially comes across as selfish, irresponsible, and childish. This presents the primary challenge of dating her, as players need to look beyond her "hot high school girl" facade and help her reveal a more relatable, caring, and generous side.

Despite her appearance and style keeping her popular, Haley retains some of her less appealing traits even after marriage, which can be off-putting for many players. For instance, she might jokingly suggest that she could do better, implying that the player might not be the ideal match for her.

3 Penny

The Challenge: Accepting Her Normie Side

  • Loved Items : Diamond, Emerald, Melon, Poppy, Poppyseed Muffin, Red Plate, Roots Platter, Sandfish, Tom Kha Soup.

Dating Penny comes with no significant downsides, but it also lacks major upsides. As the town's "normie" girl, Penny is essentially the female version of Harvey, meaning she is kind and lovely but without much in-depth character development or an intriguing backstory.

Despite this, Penny remains one of the most popular bachelorettes in Stardew Valley for exactly these reasons. Just as players choose Harvey for his emotional stability and availability, many choose Penny for her calm and predictable nature. However, those seeking a more exciting romance story might find her relationship a bit dull.

2 Emily

The Challenge: Adapting to Excitement-Free Life

  • Loved Items : Amethyst, Aquamarine, Emerald, Jade, Parrot Egg, Rubby, Topaz, Wool, Cloth, Survival Burger.

Despite being one of the nicest NPCs in Stardew Valley , Emily doesn't attract many players as a marriage candidate. However, her positive energy and bubbly personality often make her a popular choice for friendship.

The main challenge in dating Emily is that her Heart Events tend to be self-centered. There are few memorable moments throughout the relationship, and even after marriage, she remains the same predictable, people-pleasing person she was at the start. Nothing significant changes.

1 Maru

The Challenge: Dealing with Her Ongoing Family Drama

  • Loved Items : Battery Pack, Cauliflower, Cheese Cauliflower, Diamond, Dwarf Gadget, Gold Bar, Iridium Bar, Miner’s Treat, Pepper Poppers, Radioactive Bar, Rhubarb Pie, Strawberry.

Maru is a kind and ambitious character known for her independence and brilliance in Pelican Town. However, her strained relationship with her parents often overshadows the more enjoyable aspects of dating her. Players who pursue a relationship with Maru may find themselves entangled in her family drama, which can detract from the romance.

Fan-made polls over the years have consistently shown that Maru is one of the least favored bachelorettes. This is partly because her Heart Events and overall story arc fail to captivate many players. Additionally, Maru's less romantic nature compared to bachelorettes like Leah contributes to her lower popularity.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How To Get Jafar
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock Jafar In Dreamlight Valley (Overview)
  • Complete The Mysterious Mickey Quest
  • Complete The Use Your Imagination Quests
  • Complete The Palace Of Time Quest
  • Complete Jafar’s Laboratory Quest
  • Complete The Now And Then Quest
  • Complete The Lesser Evil Quest

The Treasures of Time: Act III update has introduced a new questline for Jafar in Gameloft’s beloved Disney Dreamlight Valley . Players can now finally unlock the Aladdin antagonist as a villager and use his experience to solve the mysteries of the magical valley.

Like other characters, Jafar comes with his own set of friendship quests. But of course, before saviors can start these, they’ll need to unlock him by completing a series of long and challenging quests. Below, this guide will walk you through each quest to help you unlock Jafar in Disney Dreamlight Valley .

How To Unlock Jafar In Dreamlight Valley (Overview)

To unlock Jafar in DDV, Dreamers will have to complete the following story quests of Act III:

  • Mysterious Micky
  • Use Your Imagination
  • The Palace of Time
  • Jafar’s Laboratory
  • The Now and Then
  • The Lesser Evil

Make sure you have unlocked all A Rift in Time’s Act I and Act II characters before starting the aforementioned quests.

Complete The Mysterious Mickey Quest

Jafar's first story quest begins when you enter Eternity Isle after the latest update. You’ll see a cutscene where five rifts open, and Mickey flickers between the past and present. Talk to Merlin, who will explain that Jafar’s magic has caused these time rifts. To stop Jafar, follow Merlin to a secret entrance to his palace in The Promenade of the Wild Tangle — but you'll find a giant rift blocking your way.

This massive rift is connected to all the other time rifts on the Isle. To close these rifts, talk to Mickey, EVE, Rapunzel, and Gaston for help.

Complete The Use Your Imagination Quests

Once the four Isle buddies are set to help you, you’ll have to do their respective Use Your Imagination side quests. In these quests, your friends will imagine something creative that you’ll craft to toss into the rifts to finish them off.

First, talk to Mickey Mouse and follow him to The Courtyard biome, where you will see a big rift. To end it, you will have to make a Hot Dog Cart using eight Brass Ingots and eight Bronze Ingots . After the cart is ready, make a Toon Dog and toss it into the rift with Mickey Mouse. Here’s a quick Toon Dog recipe:

  • 2 x Venison
  • 2 x Poultry
  • 2 x Pork
  • 2 x Wheat
  • 2 x Toon Sauce

To close the second rift in the Ancient Ruins, speak with EVE and WALL-E. They come up with the idea of making a movie. With WALL-E’s projector in your backpack, snap three pictures of these two robot lovebirds: one in the Ancient Ruins, one at WALL-E’s House, and one at EVE’s House. Then, craft a Film Reel using eight Plastic Scraps and three Mechanical Parts. Hand it over to EVE so the cute robot can throw it into the rift.

For your next quest, go to Rapunzel, who will ask you to create a Floating Lantern to end the time rift on Sundial Island. At a crafting station, combine 25 Tropical Wood, 10 Bamboo, and three Rope to make the lantern. Then, the player will need to ask deepest wishes from Mickey, Gaston, Oswald, and EVE for Rapunzel to write on the lantern and toss it into the rift together.

Lastly, meet Gaston to close the rift in The Wastes. With Oswald's help, Gaston will suggest making a bottle ship. Gamers will have to get their hands on 20 Softwood and 8 Glass to craft this ship, then throw it into the rift.

Complete The Palace Of Time Quest

After closing all the rifts and making your way to Jafar’s palace, the next story quest will begin. Go to The Promenade in the Wild Tangle and enter Jafar’s Argabah palace . Inside, repair the bridge by interacting with a giant hourglass, cross it, and use your Hourglass tool to remove magical obstacles. Then, activate the big hourglass on the other side to open a magical door. The palace is full of tricky puzzles, but that’s to be expected when dealing with Jafar.

Once players are inside this door, they will need to clear the obstacles to reach a large puzzle room. To solve the puzzle, interact with the massive hourglass, move the white ground plates, and rotate the mirror to align with the second magical door. After turning the hourglass, a mysterious door will open. This will lead the player to Jafar’s grand palace, but his throne room will be locked . For more help, you can check out our detailed guide on the Palace of Time quest.

Complete Jafar’s Laboratory Quest

Jafar’s Laboratory is a side quest unlocked during The Palace of Time quest where you need to find a key to access his throne . First, climb the left staircase to reach his lab. Once there, players will need to interact with the black raven in order to get a clue about the key. The raven will ask you to feed it in exchange for help.

To make Bird Food, pick up a Rotten Fish and Rotten Clam from a nearby table. Then, interact with a giant hourglass to shift time and get Ripe Carrots and Tomatoes from the same table. Once you prepare the meal and feed the raven, it will give you a Power Coil. Place the coil in the puzzle's socket, move the ground plates, and rotate the mirror to open a secret door. Next, take the key and unlock the palace gate.

Complete The Now And Then Quest

The Now and Then quest in DDV begins once you unlock the gate. Before reaching his throne, a massive rift will take you to a Black and White world where you’ll meet Mickey. He will ask you to find the following items in this colorless world:

  • WALL-E’s Film Projector
  • Mickey's Hot Dog Roaster
  • Rapunzel’s Lantern
  • Gaston's Ship

Dreamers can find WALL-E’s Film Projector near where Mickey is standing. For Mickey's Hot Dog Roaster , dig behind a large rock on the hill. After that, break the rocks on the beach to get Rapunzel’s Lantern . Finally, to get your hands on Gaston's Ship , fish out a Chest Key from the water, clear the rock obstacles at the cave entrance on the beach, and then open the chest.

Once players manages to escape the black and white world and return to the palace, they will meet Jafar and trap him in a genie lamp. After that, chat with Mickey and Merlin, and share the Spark with friends outside the palace.

Complete The Lesser Evil Quest

In Jafar’s final story quest, you’ll team up with him to end a strange geometric magic on Eternity Isle. First, talk to Oswald about the 2D cactus you saw in The Plains. He’ll explain that his experiment caused this problem. You’ll need to collect these objects from the Isle:

  • 1 x Geometrically Impaired Cactus (The Plains)
  • 1 x Geometrically Impaired Tree (The Grasslands)
  • 1 x Geometrically Impaired Statue (The Docks)

Once you’ve got all the items, take them to Merlin. He’ll ask you to grab Jafar’s Research Notes from his palace. Your next step is to go to Jafar’s Laboratory and pick up those notes on the floor. Then, head back to Merlin with the notes, and he’ll tell you to free Jafar so you can discuss this weird magic with him.

Now, players should head to the Caves of Wonder, put the lamp in the arms of the Statue of Time, and use the Royal Hourglass to free Jafar from the lamp . Once he’s out, talk to him to complete The Lesser Evil quest and unlock him as a villager in the valley.

item.title: Deadlock: How To Unlock Flex Slots
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Flex Slots In Deadlock, Explained
  • How To Unlock All Four Flex Slots In Deadlock

Valve’s newest game, Deadlock , offers an intriguing combination between Hero Shooter and MOBA, giving fans of both genres a thrilling experience. However, with such a combination, the game has several complexities that many new players might get confused about initially.

One such confusing mechanic in the game is the four flex slots the players need to unlock in each match, which are used to provide players with additional buffs and advantages over their enemies. Having upgradeable items in general, a staple among the best MOBAs out there, can feel out of place for Hero Shooter veterans. This guide is here to help explain how these flex slots work — and how to unlock them.

Flex Slots In Deadlock, Explained

Item Progression is one of the most essential mechanics in Deadlock. Players must gather enough souls throughout each match to progress through the three categories of items available ( Weapons, Vitality, and Spirit ). The game offers multiple item tiers that players can obtain, each of which grants a unique kind of boost to players in the early, mid, and late game phases.

Nevertheless, a limited number of items are available for the players to use, and each category can have up to a maximum of four items at a time . As a result, players may find themselves with additional souls in the late stages of the game without anywhere to use them.

This is when the flex slots come into play, giving the players an additional four spots to add more items from any preferred category. The total number of item slots for each player will, therefore, increase from 12 to 16 after the four flex slots are unlocked.

How To Unlock All Four Flex Slots In Deadlock

There are a total of four flex slots available for players to unlock during a match, where they can use items from any of the categories they want. Unlocking the flex slots becomes essential , especially during the mid-and late-game stages, to keep par with the enemies and gain certain advantages over the opposing heroes.

Each of the four flex slots has requirements that each player must complete to be unlocked. The requirements are:

  • Slot 1: Unlocked after your team destroys all enemy Guardians.
  • Slot 2: Unlocked after your team destroys an enemy Shrine.
  • Slot 3: Unlocked after your team destroys an enemy Walker.
  • Slot 4: Unlocked after your team destroys all enemy Walkers.

Collective teamwork is required to unlock the flex slots; if one of your teammates has fulfilled the prerequisite, that means everyone on your team will be able to access that particular flex slot. You can only really complete the conditions to unlock the first, second, and fourth spots once you're into the late game. To unlock the third slot as soon as possible, however, it is strongly advised that you work with teammates to coordinate and target one of the lane's Walkers as soon as possible — this can provide a noticeable boost early in the game.
